Beacon is not required to validate a trip
An example of DriveKit DriverData implementation with its UI for the Trip List and the Trip Detail
Enable this setting to write log on the device
Log files will be available in directory \"DriveKit\" on the device
Enable this setting to share your position during the trip
Disable this setting no to share your position during the trip
DriveKit is connected to DriveQuant production environment
DriveKit is connected to DriveQuant integration environment
Your trip was made by train
Your trip has been canceled because you are traveling by train or plane
Your trip has been canceled because your Bluetooth badge has not been recognized
The trip could not be analyzed because the GPS data could not be retrieved.
A new trip has just been analyzed
The trip could not be analyzed because the internet connection is too slow. It will be analyzed later.
Tap to fill your user id
Votre trajet a été annulé car aucune vitesse n\'a été détectée
Votre trajet a été annulé car aucune vitesse n\'a été détectée en présence du beacon

An example of DriveKit Vehicle implementation with UI for the Vehicle Picker, Vehicles List and Detail
An example of DriveKit DriverAchievement implementation with its UI for the Streaks List

This category corresponds to vehicles for professional use generally intended for the transport of goods. These vehicles have a large storage capacity and the total permissible laden weight is between 1.5 tonnes and 3.5 tonnes.
This category corresponds to vehicles belonging to segment B2. These are compact vehicles that are suitable for both urban and road use and are between 3.70 and 4.10 m long.
This category corresponds to sedans with luxurious styling and powerful engines.
This category corresponds to vehicles belonging to segments B0 and B1. These are very compact vehicles for urban use with a length of less than 3.70 m.

This category corresponds to vehicles whose interior volume is optimized for families with several children. They generally offer five to seven places. Their size varies on average from 4.80 to 5.00 m.
This category corresponds to vehicles belonging to segment D. They are larger than compact vehicles, equipped with powerful engines and whose length varies between 4.50 and 4.90 m.
This category includes vehicles with performance-oriented engines, chassis and braking systems.
This category corresponds to crossover vehicles or off-road vehicles with all-wheel drive (4x4) and whose length varies on average from 4.10 to 5.20 m.
